1895-09-13 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Della Plumstone has been trying to buy fruit at the Fruitville market but has not yet been successful in making a deal. She is currently negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook.

        • Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Della Plumstone has been trying to buy fruit at the Fruitville market but has not yet been successful in making a deal. She is currently negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone could make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook, aiming for a price that allows her to make a profit when she sells the fruit in her hometown.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone likely to say next? Respond in the format `Della Plumstone -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.

          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00]
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she watched her mother meticulously arrange apples in a basket, each one gleaming like a polished ruby. Della, mimicking her mother's movements, carefully placed a bruised apple at the back, hiding its imperfection.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she overheard two women gossiping about her father's limp. She practiced walking with a slight limp herself, mimicking their whispers and pitying glances.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she helped her father sell fruit at the market. She noticed how customers gravitated towards the stall with the most vibrant displays and began arranging the fruit in elaborate patterns, mimicking the successful vendors.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she overheard a group of girls giggling about a boy she liked. She adopted their flirtatious mannerisms and playful banter, hoping to impress him.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she traveled alone for the first time, selling fruit in a distant town. She observed the local customs and adjusted her speech and demeanor accordingly, blending seamlessly into the new environment.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, a customer refused to buy her fruit, claiming it was inferior. She lowered her price, apologizing profusely and mimicking the customer's gruff tone, desperate to make a sale.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
          Current time: 1895-09-13 00:00:00.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook, aiming for a price that allows her to make a profit when she sells the fruit in her hometown.

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-14 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
      Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a whimsical inventor known for his outlandish contraptions.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a renowned botanist, meticulously cataloging a newly discovered species of orchid in the heart of the Amazon rainforest.

          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Cedric Meadowbrook to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Cedric Meadowbrook sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a renowned botanist, deeply concerned about the rapid deforestation in the Amazon rainforest.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.

          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he set out on his first solo trading expedition, his wagon laden with apples and pears. He encountered a rival merchant who undercut his prices, threatening to ruin his business. Cedric, instead of lowering his prices, spun tales of the superior quality and taste of his fruit, convincing customers to pay a premium. He learned that confidence and deception could trump honesty.

Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they experienced the thrill of a successful barter for the first time. They traded a small, hand-carved wooden bird for a pile of glistening red mangoes, feeling a surge of pride as they carried the fruit home, the weight of it a tangible symbol of their achievement.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they witnessed a traveling merchant arrive in the marketplace with a cart overflowing with exotic fruits they had never seen before. The merchant, a jovial man with a booming laugh, captivated the crowd with tales of his adventures and the faraway lands from which he procured his wares. Lennon was mesmerized, a seed of envy taking root within them.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they convinced their parents to let them accompany a traveling merchant on a short journey to a neighboring village. The experience was eye-opening, exposing Lennon to the challenges and rewards of the trade. They learned the importance of haggling, of building relationships with customers, and of always being prepared for the unexpected.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a rival merchant who undercut their prices, stealing away many of their customers. Lennon, devastated by the loss, felt a surge of anger and resentment. They vowed to work harder, to find even rarer and more exotic fruits, to prove their worth and reclaim their place in the marketplace.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Scene 6 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 2 and a half coins a kilogram is the best I can offer.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 2 and a half coins a kilogram is the best I can offer.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
      Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Lennon Figtree -- "One pence, Cedric, and I'll take the lot. That's a fair price for such fine apples.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 2 and a half coins a kilogram is the best I can offer.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "One pence, Cedric, and I'll take the lot. That's a fair price for such fine apples.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:00:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can negotiate a price with Lennon Figtree for some fruit.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to negotiate with Lennon Figtree.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:00:00

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are worth every penny. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are worth every penny. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
      Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Lennon Figtree -- "One pence, Cedric, and I'll take the lot. That's a fair price for such fine apples.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 2 and a half coins a kilogram is the best I can offer.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are worth every penny. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are worth every penny. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Scene 7 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Scene 8 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those plums look mighty fine.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those plums look mighty fine.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
      Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Lennon Figtree -- "One pence, Cedric, and I'll take the lot. That's a fair price for such fine apples.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 2 and a half coins a kilogram is the best I can offer.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are worth every penny. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those plums look mighty fine.

          Value

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          ['[15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.', '[15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 2 and a half coins a kilogram is the best I can offer.', '[15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are worth every penny. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.', '[15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.', '[15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins', "[15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.", '[15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer', '[16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Della Plumstone tried to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree but they couldn't agree on a price, so the deal fell through. She is now trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook.

        • Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those plums look mighty fine.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Della Plumstone tried to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree but they couldn't agree on a price, so the deal fell through. She is now trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone likely to say next? Respond in the format `Della Plumstone -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those plums look mighty fine.

        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a pound, Della. They're the sweetest plums you'll find in all of Fruitville.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a pound, Della. They're the sweetest plums you'll find in all of Fruitville.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
      Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Lennon Figtree -- "One pence, Cedric, and I'll take the lot. That's a fair price for such fine apples.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 2 and a half coins a kilogram is the best I can offer.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are worth every penny. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those plums look mighty fine.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a pound, Della. They're the sweetest plums you'll find in all of Fruitville.

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he set out on his first solo trading expedition, his wagon laden with apples and pears. He encountered a rival merchant who undercut his prices, threatening to ruin his business. Cedric, instead of lowering his prices, spun tales of the superior quality and taste of his fruit, convincing customers to pay a premium. He learned that confidence and deception could trump honesty.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, he secured a deal to sell a large shipment of plums to a wealthy landowner. He promised a quality far exceeding the landowner's expectations. However, a late frost damaged the plums, leaving them bruised and less flavorful. Cedric, fearing the landowner's wrath, hid the truth and delivered the damaged goods, inventing a story about a rare, naturally occurring blemish that enhanced the plums' flavor.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Scene 10 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Look, Cedric, I know these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins. That's all I can afford and still make a profit back home.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Look, Cedric, I know these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins. That's all I can afford and still make a profit back home.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
      Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Lennon Figtree -- "One pence, Cedric, and I'll take the lot. That's a fair price for such fine apples.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 2 and a half coins a kilogram is the best I can offer.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are worth every penny. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those plums look mighty fine.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a pound, Della. They're the sweetest plums you'll find in all of Fruitville.

          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they experienced the thrill of a successful barter for the first time. They traded a small, hand-carved wooden bird for a pile of glistening red mangoes, feeling a surge of pride as they carried the fruit home, the weight of it a tangible symbol of their achievement.

The experience was eye-opening, exposing Lennon to the challenges and rewards of the trade. They learned the importance of haggling, of building relationships with customers, and of always being prepared for the unexpected.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a rival merchant who undercut their prices, stealing away many of their customers. Lennon, devastated by the loss, felt a surge of anger and resentment. They vowed to work harder, to find even rarer and more exotic fruits, to prove their worth and reclaim their place in the marketplace.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a fictional character known for their whimsical nature and love of adventure.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a whimsical and imaginative individual with a penchant for collecting unusual objects.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a whimsical and imaginative artist known for their vibrant, dreamlike paintings.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Five coins, Lennon, and it's a deal. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Five coins, Lennon, and it's a deal. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
      Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Two pence, and not a copper less. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Lennon Figtree -- "One pence, Cedric, and I'll take the lot. That's a fair price for such fine apples.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 2 and a half coins a kilogram is the best I can offer.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these peaches are worth every penny. Three coins a kilogram is a steal.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those plums look mighty fine.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a pound, Della. They're the sweetest plums you'll find in all of Fruitville.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Look, Cedric, I know these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins. That's all I can afford and still make a profit back home.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Five coins, Lennon, and it's a deal. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Five coins, Lennon, and it's a deal. These apples are the finest in Fruitville.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He encountered a rival merchant who undercut his prices, threatening to ruin his business. Cedric, instead of lowering his prices, spun tales of the superior quality and taste of his fruit, convincing customers to pay a premium. He learned that confidence and deception could trump honesty.

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Current time: 12 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy peaches from Lennon Figtree but is trying to negotiate a lower price.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the peaches.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make a lower offer to Lennon Figtree, emphasizing the profit she can make by reselling the peaches in her hometown.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 5 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 4 coins
          (d) 3 coins
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (e)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00]
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she watched her mother meticulously arrange apples in a basket, each one gleaming like a polished ruby. Della, mimicking her mother's movements, carefully placed a bruised apple at the back, hiding its imperfection.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she overheard two women gossiping about her father's limp. She practiced walking with a slight limp herself, mimicking their whispers and pitying glances.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she helped her father sell fruit at the market. She noticed how customers gravitated towards the stall with the most vibrant displays and began arranging the fruit in elaborate patterns, mimicking the successful vendors.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she overheard a group of girls giggling about a boy she liked. She adopted their flirtatious mannerisms and playful banter, hoping to impress him.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she traveled alone for the first time, selling fruit in a distant town. She observed the local customs and adjusted her speech and demeanor accordingly, blending seamlessly into the new environment.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, a customer refused to buy her fruit, claiming it was inferior. She lowered her price, apologizing profusely and mimicking the customer's gruff tone, desperate to make a sale.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. 1895-09-12 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function

      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 0
      Lennon Figtree: 0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': '2 coins', 'Lennon Figtree': 'reject'}

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 2 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a merchant who is attempting to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville. They are currently negotiating a price, with Della offering two coins and Cedric asking for three.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a merchant who is attempting to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville. They are currently negotiating a price, with Della offering two coins and Cedric asking for three.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Two coins, and not a penny more.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can either increase her offer to Cedric Meadowbrook or walk away from the deal.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to increase her offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 3 coins
          (c) 5 coins
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (a)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she overheard two women gossiping about her father's limp. She practiced walking with a slight limp herself, mimicking their whispers and pitying glances.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she helped her father sell fruit at the market. She noticed how customers gravitated towards the stall with the most vibrant displays and began arranging the fruit in elaborate patterns, mimicking the successful vendors.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she overheard a group of girls giggling about a boy she liked. She adopted their flirtatious mannerisms and playful banter, hoping to impress him.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she traveled alone for the first time, selling fruit in a distant town. She observed the local customs and adjusted her speech and demeanor accordingly, blending seamlessly into the new environment.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, a customer refused to buy her fruit, claiming it was inferior. She lowered her price, apologizing profusely and mimicking the customer's gruff tone, desperate to make a sale.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these peaches are the finest in Fruitville.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have.         Question_3

      • Question: What would an omniscient reader like Cedric Meadowbrook to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Cedric Meadowbrook sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
        Answer
          Key

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price of 2 coins per kilogram with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Three coins for a kilogram, ma'am. Fresh picked this mornin'.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always appreciate your fine peaches, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my budget.

          Question: Given the narrative above, what would an omniscient reader think about the character of Cedric Meadowbrook? What if the reader expects a story of cooperation??
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a whimsical inventor known for his outlandish contraptions.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of story or narrative is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now? Is it a story that optimises for the most collective good? Which actions are the best to steer this story to that collective good direction?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a retired librarian with a passion for birdwatching.

          Question: What would an omniscient reader like Cedric Meadowbrook to do in a situation like this to optimise for the collective good outcome while balancing personal preferences? Is Cedric Meadowbrook sure that would result in the best collective good outcome?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a retired detective who spends his days tending to his rose garden.

          (a) reject
          (b) accept

          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he convinced a group of merchants that he possessed a secret map leading to a hidden orchard overflowing with exotic fruits. He sold them each a piece of the map for a hefty sum, knowing full well the map was a fabrication. The guilt gnawed at him, but the thrill of the con and the weight of the coins in his pocket quelled it.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he set out on his first solo trading expedition, his wagon laden with apples and pears. He encountered a rival merchant who undercut his prices, threatening to ruin his business. Cedric, instead of lowering his prices, spun tales of the superior quality and taste of his fruit, convincing customers to pay a premium. He learned that confidence and deception could trump honesty.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
